Like every coffee place I go to I get a chocolate croissant. Well the one Peet's has isn't that great. Hence only 4 stars.  Lost of croissant, but not fluffy like another place.  Next time I'll tempt fate with something different.
author: Chris G.

description: Same great coffee as the other locations but the line here sucks!  It doesn't matter what time of day this place is busy.  I do like that they have seating here to enjoy the coffee and view of the bay.  They also have an extensive selection of pastries, love the sugar cookies and banana nut bread.  Nice touch on the soy milk dispenser!
author: La C.

description: Grab a coffee, sit outside and enjoy the view of the bay in one of the best cities on Earth. 'Nuff said.
author: Johnny O.

description: Since my exile to Jack London Square this has become my location of choice for morning coffee.  It gets crowded when the boats let off but the staff here is very efficient and most of the people in line are from Marin so they know how to order what every bizarre milk and coffee combination that is popular this week. Here is my one problem with this place, what is up with the birds? Can't they do something to keep them out of the Ferry Building?
author: Seamus M.

description: Peet's is my favorite big chain coffee place because it just doesn't feel so much like a cheesy numb generic big chain place, even though it pretty much is.  But it's big and chain-y enough so i don't need to waste time talking about the coffee/tea, except i have to review this one because i love that it's there for saturday farmers' market days.  It's one of the 3 coffee/tea places that is a must-stop there (not all on one day, not so far at least).  And, service is surprisingly fast.
author: Today Y.

description: Long line, but moves pretty quickly. They've got their system down. Peet's always churns out the best, strong coffee around.
author: Fern D.

description:
GOOD COFFEE! ONE OF MY FAVORITE COFFEE HOTSPOTS!
Have the greatest encounter ever! So my sister and I decided to stop by for some post-lunch coffee, and we were being environmental-friendly so she brought her own mug in. She ordered a cafe freddo, and handed the guy the mug. He came back with a volcano-filled mug with coffee eruption. He nicely apologized for the mess and insisted on having the coffee on him... so FREE COFFEE!  (of course, we tipped him)
author: Dianne I.

description: i'd choose peet's over starbucks anyday!  nuff said.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Ok, no lie. I've been drinking coffee since I was 5 when I used to sit with my mom, aunts and grandma in the kitchen while they drank coffee, smoked cigs (except ma) and chatted. I don't use cream or sugar anymore, unless the coffee is really crappy or has booze in it. Peet's is my place. Love no coffee like it. Major Dickasons on the board? I'm having a great day. The ONLY problem is ..... and you all know it.....they are so freakin slow. And you can't even be mad about it. (Ok, I am). And every Peet's is this way. EVERY ONE OF 'EM. I think it's in their business plan. Take forF____cking ever to serve 'em and people will love it. Ok, I do. I love it in spite of the wait. And the problem is I really LIKE the workers! Good folks! I'm sure the only reason I have a problem with it is because it makes me late for work every morning (and no I won't get up earlier. I need my beauty sleep). That's it. Go to Peet's. You won't find better coffee.
author: John S.

description: i'm sorry, but i have a personal vendetta against peet's. it started back-in-the-day, sometime when i was in college...picture it: i put in my barista application and was pleasantly suprised when i rec'd a phone call asking me to come in for an interview. the woman then says she has to give me a preliminary phone interview, which i passed with flying colors. i go in for my in-person interview and hit it off with my interviewer. job is in the bag, i'm thinking...then this woman says i have to then come back for another interview with the co-manager. after three motherfuckin interviews for PEET'S COFFEE (of all places), i did NOT get hired. are they fucking serious??? 3 INTERVIEWS so i can make $9/hr. i waged an 8 yr war with this place and recently decided to let bygones be bygones. after all, i've grown as a person and maybe they've grown as an establishment...so i order my specialty "fall" latte (something with spices and such...) and it tasted like artificial shit. note, this is BEFORE i put my two packets of splenda in. oh, and one more thing - i remember a looong time ago, i asked for a raspberry vanilla latte and was snottily told by the peet's employee that they didn't use "flavorings" because they ruined the integrity of the coffee. what's up with all the bottles of flavorings they now carry?? s-e-l-l o-u-t. i would rather drink starsucks.
author: eve l.
